intro: Malortiea, commonly known as the common daisy, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its daisy-like flowers, which consist of a central disc surrounded by ray florets. The plant typically grows in a variety of habitats, including meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils. Malortiea has lance-shaped to oval leaves that are usually arranged alternately along the stem. It is known for its ability to thrive in temperate climates and is often found in gardens and wildflower landscapes.
